mdq:check.name: Entity Attribute Units Defined
mdq:check.description: Check that units are defined for each attribute that should have them.
mdq:check.code:
def call(): global output global status global attributeUnits global attributeName
import metadig.variable as mvar maxPrint = 5
# Check if measurement units are present for each attribute.
if not attributesPresent: output = "No attributes were found so unable to check attribute units." status = "FAILURE" return False
attributeCount = 0 missing = []
attributeUnits = mvar.toUnicode(attributeUnits) attributeName = mvar.toUnicode(attributeName)
# If only a single value is returned (vs type "list"), then convert to a list # for easier processing if(isinstance(attributeUnits, unicode)): attributeUnits = [attributeUnits]
if(isinstance(attributeName, unicode)): attributeName = [attributeName]
for i in range(0, len(attributeUnits)): attributeCount += 1 units = attributeUnits[i] name = attributeName[i] if(name is None): name = "#{}".format(i)
# No units for this attribute was specified if(units == None or mvar.isBlank(units)): missing.append(name)
if(len(missing) > 0): output = u"The following attributes are missing a units value: '{}'".format(', '.join(missing[0:maxPrint])) if(len(missing) > maxPrint): output += u", ..." status = "FAILURE" return False elif(len(missing) == 0 and len(attributeUnits) == 0): output = "Attributes exist, but none of them require unit defintions." status = "SUCCESS" return True else: output = "All {} attributes that require units have them defined.".format(attributeCount) status = "SUCCESS" return True
